critters.name: White-tailed Deer
critters.summary: Common woodland browser often seen around feeders.

critters.name: Raccoon
critters.summary: Nocturnal forager known for clever paws and curiosity.

critters.name: Eastern Gray Squirrel
critters.summary: Fast tree runner that raids feeders and caches food.

critters.name: American Red Squirrel
critters.summary: Small, bold, and territorial with a big attitude.

critters.name: Eastern Chipmunk
critters.summary: Ground critter that darts in for seeds and disappears fast.

critters.name: Virginia Opossum
critters.summary: Slow-moving nighttime scavenger that patrols for leftovers.

critters.name: Eastern Cottontail
critters.summary: Edge-of-woods grazer with quick escape hops.

critters.name: Striped Skunk
critters.summary: Night forager famous for a strong defense strategy.

critters.name: Blue Jay
critters.summary: Bold feeder visitor that calls out everything happening.

critters.name: Northern Cardinal
critters.summary: Bright songbird often seen near brushy edges and feeders.

critters.name: Black-capped Chickadee
critters.summary: Tiny, fearless feeder regular that grabs-and-goes.

critters.name: White-breasted Nuthatch
critters.summary: Tree-trunk climber that often moves headfirst down bark.

critters.name: Downy Woodpecker
critters.summary: Small woodpecker that taps and pecks around trees and feeders.

critters.name: Hairy Woodpecker
critters.summary: Larger look-alike of the downy with a stronger peck.

critters.name: Mourning Dove
critters.summary: Gentle ground feeder that often visits in pairs or small groups.

critters.name: American Goldfinch
critters.summary: Seed lover that brightens up feeders, especially in season.

critters.name: Dark-eyed Junco
critters.summary: Winter regular that feeds low and flicks around the ground.

critters.name: House Finch
critters.summary: Social seed-eater that often arrives in small groups.

critters.name: Pileated Woodpecker
critters.summary: Big woodpecker with a bold crest and loud presence.

critters.name: Tufted Titmouse
critters.summary: Curious feeder visitor with a small crest and quick hops.

critters.name: Common Grackle
critters.summary: Glossy blackbird that can roll in loud and hungry.

critters.name: Red-winged Blackbird
critters.summary: Marsh-edge singer with bold shoulder patches in season.

critters.name: Flying Squirrel
critters.summary: Night visitor that glides between trees and hits feeders fast.

critters.name: Owl
critters.summary: Silent night hunter you may hear more often than see.

critters.name: Bat
critters.summary: Night flyer that patrols for insects over open areas.

critters.name: Coyote
critters.summary: Often heard at night and sometimes seen crossing open trails.

critters.name: American Bullfrog
critters.summary: Big pond frog known for a deep, booming call.

critters.name: Green Frog
critters.summary: Pond-edge frog that likes warm shallows and sunny banks.

critters.name: Spring Peeper
critters.summary: Tiny frog famous for loud springtime choruses.

critters.name: Snapping Turtle
critters.summary: Large turtle that prefers muddy bottoms and slow water.

critters.name: Painted Turtle
critters.summary: Basks on logs and rocks when the sun is out.

critters.name: Garter Snake
critters.summary: Common, harmless snake often seen near grass and water edges.

critters.name: Bluegill
critters.summary: Common panfish often found near shallow cover.

critters.name: Largemouth Bass
critters.summary: Ambush predator that likes weeds, logs, and shady edges.

critters.name: Yellow Perch
critters.summary: Schooling fish known for striped sides and quick bites.

critters.name: Northern Pike
critters.summary: Long, fast predator that waits in cover then strikes.

critters.name: Muskrat
critters.summary: Shoreline swimmer that cruises slow water and builds shelters.

critters.name: Leopard Frog
critters.summary: Pond-edge frog that prefers wet grass and shallow water.

critters.name: Monarch Butterfly
critters.summary: Bright orange butterfly known for long-distance migration.

critters.name: Dragonfly
critters.summary: Fast pond patrol insect often seen zipping over water.

critters.name: Firefly
critters.summary: Summer night glower that flashes signals in the grass.

critters.name: Honeybee
critters.summary: Pollinator that visits flowers and carries pollen back to the hive.

critters.name: Bumblebee
critters.summary: Fuzzy pollinator often active in cooler weather than other bees.

critters.name: Grasshopper
critters.summary: Jumping insect common in fields and trail edges.
